entry.title: Same as it ever was
entry.content: A bit of house keeping, still not finding the time to update pages despite my best intentions.
entry.summary: A bit of house keeping, still not finding the time to update pages despite my best intentions.

entry.title: Rocket Firing Boba Fett
entry.content:
Yes, they don't really exists, until now. In 1978 up to 100 prototype rocket firing Boba Fett action figures were made until several children were injured and one killed by the rocket from the rocket firing Colonial Viper toy. Kenner quickly shifted gears and fixed the rocket to the jetpack.
Bootleg figures were recently produced and I couldn't help getting a J and L model.
![alt text](/assets/img/rocket_fett_front.jpg "Fett Front") ![alt text](/assets/img/rocket_fett_rear.jpg "Fett Back")
For more info and an awesome channel all around, see
<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Fn3mHd8t2nk" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>
entry.summary: Yes, they don’t really exists, until now. In 1978 up to 100 prototype rocket firing Boba Fett action figures were made until several children were injured and one killed by the rocket from the rocket firing Colonial Viper toy. Kenner quickly shifted gears and fixed the rocket to the jetpack.

entry.title: Theme
entry.content:
A Borrowed Theme ----------------
I wasted a lot of time trying to come up with a custom theme, in the end I decided to just steal^H^H^H^H^Hborrow one from [Kyle Stratis](http://kylestratis.com/2015/05/05/blog-setup-pt2/).
That way something would be updated in century.

entry.title: Dome Drive
entry.content:
Finally, something is moving on the R2.
<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nY0vveZ12LM" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>
The gear is taken from [Media Conversions](http://r2d2.media-conversions.net/), I took the basic dxf file, imported it into Fusion 360, extruded it, and chopped it up using a jigsaw type connection so each piece would fit on my print bed. So far I'm very happy with the result.
I'm powering it right now with a small 12V DC power adapter intended for use with LED strips. However it may be underpowered, the Arduino seems to reset after continuous use. The DC motor may be pulling too many amps.
entry.summary: Finally, something is moving on the R2. The gear is taken from Media Conversions, I took the basic dxf file, imported it into Fusion 360, extruded it, and chopped it up using a jigsaw type connection so each piece would fit on my print bed. So far I’m very happy with the result. I’m powering it right now with a small 12V DC power adapter intended for use with LED strips. However it may be underpowered, the Arduino seems to reset after continuous use. The DC motor may be pulling too many amps.

entry.title: Another reboot
entry.content: Years have gone by and I haven't done a thing with this website. Here's a quick reboot so at least it looks nice.
